intro: Eurylepis tetragona, commonly known as the four-sided eurylepis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in grassland and rocky areas. The plant is characterized by its narrow, four-sided stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Eurylepis tetragona is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
